intro: Ptilotus lanatus, commonly known as the silky bush or silky wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its unique appearance and adaptability to harsh environments make it a notable species in its native habitat. Ptilotus lanatus is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
